title: The Science of Circadian Rhythms – Why Your Sleep Schedule Matters
excerpt:
Understanding your internal clock is the first step toward better energy levels. 
When we disrupt our natural rhythm, both physical health and mental clarity suffer.
contentText:
There is a fascinating biological mechanism that governs almost every cell in your body—the circadian rhythm. Most people know it simply as their 'body clock,' but its influence goes much deeper than just telling you when to sleep.

Modern life is a constant battle against this clock. Artificial blue light, late-night snacking, and irregular work hours force our bodies to operate out of sync with nature. This leads to a state of 'social jetlag.'

Symptoms often include:

Persistent Fatigue: Even after 8 hours of sleep, you feel drained.

Brain Fog: Difficulty focusing on complex tasks during the first few hours of the day.

Metabolic Shifts: Your body struggles to process nutrients efficiently at the 'wrong' times.

However, the solution isn't a miracle pill. It’s about small, consistent adjustments. 

By exposing yourself to natural sunlight within 30 minutes of waking up, you 'reset' the timer. By dimming lights in the evening, you allow melatonin to rise naturally. It’s not about perfect optimization; it’s about listening to the biological signals your body has been sending for millennia.

Health isn't a destination; it's the rhythm of your daily choices.
author: Dr. Aris Thorne
